00017 package WeBWorK::Authen;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::Authen - Check user identity, manage session keys.
00022 
00023 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00024 
00025  # get the name of the appropriate Authen class, based on the %authen hash in $ce
00026  my $class_name = WeBWorK::Authen::class($ce, "user_module");
00027  
00028  # load that class
00029  require $class_name;
00030  
00031  # create an authen object
00032  my $authen = $class_name->new($r);
00033  
00034  # verify credentials
00035  $authen->verify or die "Authentication failed";
00036  
00037  # verification status is stored for quick retrieval later
00038  my $auth_ok = $authen->was_verified;
00039  
00040  # for some reason, you might want to clear that cache
00041  $authen->forget_verification;
00042 
00043 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00044 
00045 WeBWorK::Authen is the base class for all WeBWorK authentication classes. It
00046 provides default authentication behavior which can be selectively overridden in
00047 subclasses.
00048 
00049 =cut
00050

00058 use WeBWorK::Localize;
00059 use URI::Escape;

00062 use constant MP2 => ( exists $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} and $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} >= 2 );

00090 ################################################################################
00091 # Public API
00092 ################################################################################
00093 
00094 =head1 FACTORY
00095 
00096 =over
00097 
00098 =item class($ce, $type)
00099 
00100 This subroutine consults the given WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment object to
00101 determine which WeBWorK::Authen subclass should be used. $type can be any key
00102 given in the %authen hash in the course environment. If the type is not found in
00103 the %authen hash, an exception is thrown.
00104 
00105 =cut
00106 
00107 sub class {
00108     my ($ce, $type) = @_;
00109     
00110     if (exists $ce->{authen}{$type}) {
00111         if (ref $ce->{authen}{$type} eq "HASH") {
00112             if (exists $ce->{authen}{$type}{$ce->{dbLayoutName}}) {
00113                 return $ce->{authen}{$type}{$ce->{dbLayoutName}};
00114             } elsif (exists $ce->{authen}{$type}{"*"}) {
00115                 return $ce->{authen}{$type}{"*"};
00116             } else {
00117                 die "authentication type '$type' in %authen hash in course environemnt has no entry for db layout '", $ce->{dbLayoutName}, "' and no default entry (*)";
00118             }
00119         } else {
00120             return $ce->{authen}{$type};
00121         }
00122     } else {
00123         die "authentication type '$type' not found in course environment \%authen hash";
00124     }
00125 }
00126 
00127 =back
00128 
00129 =cut
00130 
00131 =head1 CONSTRUCTOR
00132 
00133 =over
00134 
00135 =item new($r)
00136 
00137 Instantiates a new WeBWorK::Authen object for the given WeBWorK::Requst ($r).
00138 
00139 =cut
00140 
00141 sub new {
00142     my ($invocant, $r) = @_;
00143     my $class = ref($invocant) || $invocant;
00144     my $self = {
00145         r => $r,
00146     };
00147     #initialize
00148     $GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE = $r->maketext("Invalid user ID or password.");
00149     bless $self, $class;
00150     return $self;
00151 }
00152 
00153 =back
00154 
00155 =cut

00157 =head1 METHODS

00162 
00163 sub verify {
00164     debug("BEGIN VERIFY");
00165     my $self = shift;
00166     my $r = $self->{r};
00167     
00168     my $result = $self->do_verify;
00169     my $error = $self->{error};
00170     my $log_error = $self->{log_error};
00171     
00172     $self->{was_verified} = $result ? 1 : 0;
00173     
00174     if ($self->can("site_fixup")) {
00175         $self->site_fixup;
00176     }
00177     
00178     if ($result) {
00179         $self->write_log_entry("LOGIN OK") if $self->{initial_login};
00180         $self->maybe_send_cookie;
00181         $self->set_params;
00182     } else {
00183         if (defined $log_error) {
00184             $self->write_log_entry("LOGIN FAILED $log_error");
00185         }
00186         $self->maybe_kill_cookie;
00187         if ($error) {
00188             MP2 ? $r->notes->set(authen_error => $error) : $r->notes("authen_error" => $error);
00189         }
00190     }
00191     
00192     debug("END VERIFY");
00193     return $result;
00194 }
00195 
00196 =item was_verified()
00197 
00198 Returns true if verify() returned true the last time it was called.
00199 
00200 =cut
00201 
00202 sub was_verified {
00203     my ($self) = @_;
00204     
00205     return 1 if exists $self->{was_verified} and $self->{was_verified};
00206     return 0;
00207 }
00208 
00209 =item forget_verification()
00210 
00211 Future calls to was_verified() will return false, until verify() is called again and succeeds.
00212 
00213 =cut
00214 
00215 sub forget_verification {
00216     my ($self) = @_;
00217     
00218     $self->{was_verified} = 0;
00219 }
00220 
00221 =back
00222 
00223 =cut

00225 ################################################################################
00226 # Helper functions (called by verify)
00227 ################################################################################
00228 
00229 sub do_verify {
00230     my $self = shift;
00231     my $r = $self->{r};
00232     my $ce = $r->ce;
00233     my $db = $r->db;
00234     
00235     return 0 unless $db;
00236     
00237     return 0 unless $self->get_credentials;
00238     
00239     return 0 unless $self->check_user;
00240     
00241     my $practiceUserPrefix = $ce->{practiceUserPrefix};
00242     if (defined($self->{login_type}) && $self->{login_type} eq "guest"){
00243         return $self->verify_practice_user;
00244     } else {
00245         return $self->verify_normal_user;
00246     }
00247 }
00248 
00249 sub get_credentials {
00250     my ($self) = @_;
00251     my $r = $self->{r};
00252     my $ce = $r->ce;
00253     my $db = $r->db;
00254     
00255     # allow guest login: if the "Guest Login" button was clicked, we find an unused
00256     # practice user and create a session for it.
00257     if ($r->param("login_practice_user")) {
00258         my $practiceUserPrefix = $ce->{practiceUserPrefix};
00259         # DBFIX search should happen in database
00260         my @guestUserIDs = grep m/^$practiceUserPrefix/, $db->listUsers;
00261         my @GuestUsers = $db->getUsers(@guestUserIDs);
00262         my @allowedGuestUsers = grep { $ce->status_abbrev_has_behavior($_->status, "allow_course_access") } @GuestUsers;
00263         my @allowedGestUserIDs = map { $_->user_id } @allowedGuestUsers;
00264         
00265         foreach my $userID (@allowedGestUserIDs) {
00266             if (not $self->unexpired_session_exists($userID)) {
00267                 my $newKey = $self->create_session($userID);
00268                 $self->{initial_login} = 1;
00269                 
00270                 $self->{user_id} = $userID;
00271                 $self->{session_key} = $newKey;
00272                 $self->{login_type} = "guest";
00273                 $self->{credential_source} = "none";
00274                 debug("guest user '", $userID. "' key '", $newKey. "'");
00275                 return 1;
00276             }
00277         }
00278         
00279         $self->{log_error} = "no guest logins are available";
00280         $self->{error} = "No guest logins are available. Please try again in a few minutes.";
00281         return 0;
00282     }
00283     
00284     # at least the user ID is available in request parameters
00285     if (defined $r->param("user")) {
00286         $self->{user_id} = $r->param("user");
00287         $self->{session_key} = $r->param("key");
00288         $self->{password} = $r->param("passwd");
00289         $self->{login_type} = "normal";
00290         $self->{credential_source} = "params";
00291         debug("params user '", $self->{user_id}, "' password '", $self->{password}, "' key '", $self->{session_key}, "'");
00292         return 1;
00293     }
00294     
00295     my ($cookieUser, $cookieKey) = $self->fetchCookie;
00296     if (defined $cookieUser) {
00297         $self->{user_id} = $cookieUser;
00298         $self->{session_key} = $cookieKey;
00299         $self->{login_type} = "normal";
00300         $self->{credential_source} = "cookie";
00301         debug("cookie user '", $self->{user_id}, "' key '", $self->{session_key}, "'");
00302         return 1;
00303     }
00304 }
00305 
00306 sub check_user {
00307     my $self = shift;
00308     my $r = $self->{r};
00309     my $ce = $r->ce;
00310     my $db = $r->db;
00311     my $authz = $r->authz;
00312     
00313     my $user_id = $self->{user_id};
00314     
00315     if (defined $user_id and $user_id eq "") {
00316         $self->{log_error} = "no user id specified";
00317         $self->{error} = $r->maketext("You must specify a user ID.");
00318         return 0;
00319     }
00320     
00321     my $User = $db->getUser($user_id);
00322     
00323     unless ($User) {
00324         $self->{log_error} = "user unknown";
00325         $self->{error} = $GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE;
00326         return 0;
00327     }
00328     
00329     # FIXME "fix invalid status values" used to be here, but it needs to move to $db->getUser
00330     
00331     unless ($ce->status_abbrev_has_behavior($User->status, "allow_course_access")) {
00332         $self->{log_error} = "user not allowed course access";
00333         $self->{error} = $GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE;
00334         return 0;
00335     }
00336     
00337     unless ($authz->hasPermissions($user_id, "login")) {
00338         $self->{log_error} = "user not permitted to login";
00339         $self->{error} = $GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE;
00340         return 0;
00341     }
00342     
00343     return 1;
00344 }
00345 
00346 sub verify_practice_user {
00347     my $self = shift;
00348     my $r = $self->{r};
00349     my $ce = $r->ce;
00350     
00351     my $user_id = $self->{user_id};
00352     my $session_key = $self->{session_key};
00353     
00354     my ($sessionExists, $keyMatches, $timestampValid) = $self->check_session($user_id, $session_key, 1);
00355     debug("sessionExists='", $sessionExists, "' keyMatches='", $keyMatches, "' timestampValid='", $timestampValid, "'");
00356     
00357     if ($sessionExists) {
00358         if ($keyMatches) {
00359             if ($timestampValid) {
00360                 return 1;
00361             } else {
00362                 $self->{session_key} = $self->create_session($user_id);
00363                 $self->{initial_login} = 1;
00364                 return 1;
00365             }
00366         } else {
00367             if ($timestampValid) {
00368                 my $debugPracticeUser = $ce->{debugPracticeUser};
00369                 if (defined $debugPracticeUser and $user_id eq $debugPracticeUser) {
00370                     $self->{session_key} = $self->create_session($user_id);
00371                     $self->{initial_login} = 1;
00372                     return 1;
00373                 } else {
00374                     $self->{log_error} = "guest account in use";
00375                     $self->{error} = "That guest account is in use.";
00376                     return 0;
00377                 }
00378             } else {
00379                 $self->{session_key} = $self->create_session($user_id);
00380                 $self->{initial_login} = 1;
00381                 return 1;
00382             }
00383         }
00384     } else {
00385         $self->{session_key} = $self->create_session($user_id);
00386         $self->{initial_login} = 1;
00387         return 1;
00388     }
00389 }
00390 
00391 sub verify_normal_user {
00392     my $self = shift;
00393     my $r = $self->{r};
00394     
00395     my $user_id = $self->{user_id};
00396     my $session_key = $self->{session_key};
00397     
00398     my ($sessionExists, $keyMatches, $timestampValid) = $self->check_session($user_id, $session_key, 1);
00399     debug("sessionExists='", $sessionExists, "' keyMatches='", $keyMatches, "' timestampValid='", $timestampValid, "'");
00400     
00401     if ($keyMatches and $timestampValid) {
00402         return 1;
00403     } else {
00404         my $auth_result = $self->authenticate;
00405         
00406         if ($auth_result > 0) {
00407             $self->{session_key} = $self->create_session($user_id);
00408             $self->{initial_login} = 1;
00409             return 1;
00410         } elsif ($auth_result == 0) {
00411             $self->{log_error} = "authentication failed";
00412             $self->{error} = $GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE;
00413             return 0;
00414         } else { # ($auth_result < 0) => required data was not present
00415             if ($keyMatches and not $timestampValid) {
00416                 $self->{error} = $r->maketext("Your session has timed out due to inactivity. Please log in again.");
00417             }
00418             return 0;
00419         }
00420     }
00421 }
00422 
00423 #  1 == authentication succeeded
00424 #  0 == required data was present, but authentication failed
00425 # -1 == required data was not present (i.e. password missing)
00426 sub authenticate {
00427     my $self = shift;
00428     my $r = $self->{r};
00429     
00430     my $user_id = $self->{user_id};
00431     my $password = $self->{password};
00432     
00433     if (defined $password) {
00434         return $self->checkPassword($user_id, $password);
00435     } else {
00436         return -1;
00437     }
00438 }
00439 
00440 sub maybe_send_cookie {
00441     my $self = shift;
00442     my $r = $self->{r};
00443     
00444     my ($cookie_user, $cookie_key) = $self->fetchCookie;
00445     
00446     # we send a cookie if any of these conditions are met:
00447     
00448     # (a) a cookie was used for authentication
00449     my $used_cookie = ($self->{credential_source} eq "cookie");
00450     
00451     # (b) a cookie was sent but not used for authentication, and the
00452     #     credentials used for authentication were the same as those in
00453     #     the cookie
00454     my $unused_valid_cookie = ($self->{credential_source} ne "cookie"
00455         and defined $cookie_user and $self->{user_id} eq $cookie_user
00456         and defined $cookie_key and $self->{session_key} eq $cookie_key);
00457     
00458     # (c) the user asked to have a cookie sent and is not a guest user.
00459     my $user_requests_cookie = ($self->{login_type} ne "guest"
00460         and $r->param("send_cookie"));
00461     
00462     debug("used_cookie='", $used_cookie, "' unused_valid_cookie='", $unused_valid_cookie, "' user_requests_cookie='", $user_requests_cookie, "'");
00463     
00464     if ($used_cookie or $unused_valid_cookie or $user_requests_cookie) {
00465         $self->sendCookie($self->{user_id}, $self->{session_key});
00466     } else {
00467         $self->killCookie;
00468     }
00469 }
00470 
00471 sub maybe_kill_cookie {
00472     my $self = shift;
00473     $self->killCookie(@_);
00474 }
00475 
00476 sub set_params {
00477     my $self = shift;
00478     my $r = $self->{r};
00479     
00480     # A2 - params are not non-modifiable, with no explanation or workaround given in docs. WTF!
00481     $r->param("user", $self->{user_id});
00482     $r->param("key", $self->{session_key});
00483     $r->param("passwd", "");
00484     
00485     debug("params user='", $r->param("user"), "' key='", $r->param("key"), "' passwd='", $r->param("passwd"), "'");
00486 }

00488 ################################################################################
00489 # Password management
00490 ################################################################################
00491 
00492 sub checkPassword {
00493     my ($self, $userID, $possibleClearPassword) = @_;
00494     my $db = $self->{r}->db;
00495     
00496     my $Password = $db->getPassword($userID); # checked
00497     if (defined $Password) {
00498         # check against WW password database
00499         my $possibleCryptPassword = crypt $possibleClearPassword, $Password->password;
00500         if ($possibleCryptPassword eq $Password->password) {
00501             $self->write_log_entry("AUTH WWDB: password accepted");
00502             return 1;
00503         } else {
00504             if ($self->can("site_checkPassword")) {
00505                 $self->write_log_entry("AUTH WWDB: password rejected, deferring to site_checkPassword");
00506                 return $self->site_checkPassword($userID, $possibleClearPassword);
00507             } else {
00508                 $self->write_log_entry("AUTH WWDB: password rejected");
00509                 return 0;
00510             }
00511         }
00512     } else {
00513         $self->write_log_entry("AUTH WWDB: user has no password record");
00514         return 0;
00515     }
00516 }
00517 
00518 # Site-specific password checking
00519 # 
00520 # The site_checkPassword routine can be used to provide a hook to your institution's
00521 # authentication system. If authentication against the  course's password database, the
00522 # method $self->site_checkPassword($userID, $clearTextPassword) is called. If this
00523 # method returns a true value, authentication succeeds.
00524 # 
00525 # Here is an example site_checkPassword which checks the password against the Ohio State
00526 # popmail server:
00527 #   sub site_checkPassword {
00528 #       my ($self, $userID, $clearTextPassword) = @_;
00529 #       use Net::POP3;
00530 #       my $pop = Net::POP3->new('pop.service.ohio-state.edu', Timeout => 60);
00531 #       if ($pop->login($userID, $clearTextPassword)) {
00532 #           return 1;
00533 #       }
00534 #       return 0;
00535 #   }
00536 # 
00537 # Since you have access to the WeBWorK::Authen object, the possibilities are limitless!
00538 # This example checks the password against the system password database and updates the
00539 # user's password in the course database if it succeeds:
00540 #   sub site_checkPassword {
00541 #       my ($self, $userID, $clearTextPassword) = @_;
00542 #       my $realCryptPassword = (getpwnam $userID)[1] or return 0;
00543 #       my $possibleCryptPassword = crypt($possibleClearPassword, $realCryptPassword); # user real PW as salt
00544 #       if ($possibleCryptPassword eq $realCryptPassword) {
00545 #           # update WeBWorK password
00546 #           use WeBWorK::Utils qw(cryptPassword);
00547 #           my $db = $self->{r}->db;
00548 #           my $Password = $db->getPassword($userID);
00549 #           my $pass = cryptPassword($clearTextPassword);
00550 #           $Password->password($pass);
00551 #           $db->putPassword($Password);
00552 #           return 1;
00553 #       } else {
00554 #           return 0;
00555 #       }
00556 #   }
00557 
00558 ################################################################################
00559 # Session key management
00560 ################################################################################
00561 
00562 sub unexpired_session_exists {
00563     my ($self, $userID) = @_;
00564     my $ce = $self->{r}->ce;
00565     my $db = $self->{r}->db;
00566     
00567     my $Key = $db->getKey($userID); # checked
00568     return 0 unless defined $Key;
00569     if (time <= $Key->timestamp()+$ce->{sessionKeyTimeout}) {
00570         # unexpired, but leave timestamp alone
00571         return 1;
00572     } else {
00573         # expired -- delete key
00574         # NEW: no longer delete the key here -- a user re-visiting with a formerly-valid key should
00575         # always get a "session expired" message. formerly, if they i.e. reload the login screen
00576         # the message disappears, which is confusing (i claim ;)
00577         #$db->deleteKey($userID);
00578         return 0;
00579     }
00580 }
00581 
00582 # clobbers any existing session for this $userID
00583 # if $newKey is not specified, a random key is generated
00584 # the key is returned
00585 sub create_session {
00586     my ($self, $userID, $newKey) = @_;
00587     my $ce = $self->{r}->ce;
00588     my $db = $self->{r}->db;
00589     
00590     my $timestamp = time;
00591     unless ($newKey) {
00592         my @chars = @{ $ce->{sessionKeyChars} };
00593         my $length = $ce->{sessionKeyLength};
00594         
00595         srand;
00596         $newKey = join ("", @chars[map rand(@chars), 1 .. $length]);
00597     }
00598     
00599     my $Key = $db->newKey(user_id=>$userID, key=>$newKey, timestamp=>$timestamp);
00600     # DBFIXME this should be a REPLACE
00601     eval { $db->deleteKey($userID) };
00602     $db->addKey($Key);
00603     return $newKey;
00604 }
00605 
00606 # returns ($sessionExists, $keyMatches, $timestampValid)
00607 # if $updateTimestamp is true, the timestamp on a valid session is updated
00608 sub check_session {
00609     my ($self, $userID, $possibleKey, $updateTimestamp) = @_;
00610     my $ce = $self->{r}->ce;
00611     my $db = $self->{r}->db;
00612     
00613     my $Key = $db->getKey($userID); # checked
00614     return 0 unless defined $Key;
00615     
00616     my $keyMatches = (defined $possibleKey and $possibleKey eq $Key->key);
00617     my $timestampValid = (time <= $Key->timestamp()+$ce->{sessionKeyTimeout});
00618     
00619     if ($keyMatches and $timestampValid and $updateTimestamp) {
00620         $Key->timestamp(time);
00621         $db->putKey($Key);
00622     }
00623     
00624     return (1, $keyMatches, $timestampValid);
00625 }
00626 
00627 ################################################################################
00628 # Cookie management
00629 ################################################################################
00630 
00631 sub fetchCookie {
00632     my $self = shift;
00633     my $r = $self->{r};
00634     my $ce = $r->ce;
00635     my $urlpath = $r->urlpath;
00636     
00637     my $courseID = $urlpath->arg("courseID");
00638     
00639     # AP2 - Apache2::Cookie needs $r, Apache::Cookie doesn't
00640     #my %cookies = WeBWorK::Cookie->fetch( MP2 ? $r : () );
00641     #my $cookie = $cookies{"WeBWorKCourseAuthen.$courseID"};
00642     
00643     my $cookie = undef;
00644     if (MP2) {
00645         
00646         my $jar = undef;
00647         eval {
00648                 $jar = $r->jar; #table of cookies
00649         };
00650         if (ref $@ and $@->isa("APR::Request::Error") ) {
00651             debug("Error parsing cookies, will use a partial result");
00652                 $jar = $@->jar; # table of successfully parsed cookies
00653         };
00654         if ($jar) {
00655             $cookie = uri_unescape( $jar->get("WeBWorKCourseAuthen.$courseID") );
00656         };
00657     } else {
00658         my %cookies = WeBWorK::Cookie->fetch();
00659         $cookie = $cookies{"WeBWorKCourseAuthen.$courseID"};
00660         if ($cookie) {
00661             debug("found a cookie for this course: '", $cookie->as_string, "'");
00662             $cookie = $cookie->value;
00663         }
00664     }
00665 
00666     if ($cookie) {
00667         #debug("found a cookie for this course: '", $cookie->as_string, "'");
00668         #debug("cookie has this value: '", $cookie->value, "'");
00669         #my ($userID, $key) = split "\t", $cookie->value;
00670         debug("cookie has this value: '", $cookie, "'");
00671         my ($userID, $key) = split "\t", $cookie;
00672         if (defined $userID and defined $key and $userID ne "" and $key ne "") {
00673             debug("looks good, returning userID='$userID' key='$key'");
00674             return $userID, $key;
00675         } else {
00676             debug("malformed cookie. returning nothing.");
00677             return;
00678         }
00679     } else {
00680         debug("found no cookie for this course. returning nothing.");
00681         return;
00682     }
00683 }
00684 
00685 sub sendCookie {
00686     my ($self, $userID, $key) = @_;
00687     my $r = $self->{r};
00688     my $ce = $r->ce;
00689     
00690     my $courseID = $r->urlpath->arg("courseID");
00691     
00692     my $expires = time2str("%a, %d-%h-%Y %H:%M:%S %Z", time+COOKIE_LIFESPAN, "GMT");
00693     my $cookie = WeBWorK::Cookie->new($r,
00694         -name    => "WeBWorKCourseAuthen.$courseID",
00695         -value   => "$userID\t$key",
00696         -expires => $expires,
00697         -domain  => $r->hostname,
00698         -path    => $ce->{webworkURLRoot},
00699         -secure  => 0,
00700     );
00701     
00702     debug("about to add Set-Cookie header with this string: '", $cookie->as_string, "'");
00703     $r->headers_out->set("Set-Cookie" => $cookie->as_string);
00704 }
00705 
00706 sub killCookie {
00707     my ($self) = @_;
00708     my $r = $self->{r};
00709     my $ce = $r->ce;
00710     
00711     my $courseID = $r->urlpath->arg("courseID");
00712     
00713     my $expires = time2str("%a, %d-%h-%Y %H:%M:%S %Z", time-60*60*24, "GMT");
00714     my $cookie = WeBWorK::Cookie->new($r,
00715         -name => "WeBWorKCourseAuthen.$courseID",
00716         -value => "\t",
00717         -expires => $expires,
00718         -domain => $r->hostname,
00719         -path => $ce->{webworkURLRoot},
00720         -secure => 0,
00721     );
00722     
00723     debug("about to add Set-Cookie header with this string: '", $cookie->as_string, "'");
00724     $r->headers_out->set("Set-Cookie" => $cookie->as_string);
00725 }
00726 
00727 ################################################################################
00728 # Utilities
00729 ################################################################################
00730 
00731 sub write_log_entry {
00732     my ($self, $message) = @_;
00733     my $r = $self->{r};
00734     my $ce = $r->ce;
00735     
00736     my $user_id = defined $self->{user_id} ? $self->{user_id} : "";
00737     my $login_type = defined $self->{login_type} ? $self->{login_type} : "";
00738     my $credential_source = defined $self->{credential_source} ? $self->{credential_source} : "";
00739     
00740     my ($remote_host, $remote_port);
00741     if (MP2) {
00742         $remote_host = $r->connection->remote_addr->ip_get || "UNKNOWN";
00743         $remote_port = $r->connection->remote_addr->port || "UNKNOWN";
00744     } else {
00745         ($remote_port, $remote_host) = unpack_sockaddr_in($r->connection->remote_addr);
00746         $remote_host = defined $remote_host ? inet_ntoa($remote_host) : "UNKNOWN";
00747         $remote_port = "UNKNOWN" unless defined $remote_port;
00748     }
00749     my $user_agent = $r->headers_in->{"User-Agent"};
00750     
00751     my $log_msg = "$message user_id=$user_id login_type=$login_type credential_source=$credential_source host=$remote_host port=$remote_port UA=$user_agent";
00752     debug("Writing to login log: '$log_msg'.\n");
00753     writeCourseLog($ce, "login_log", $log_msg);
00754 }
00755 
00756 1;
